title: Reasonable Adjustments for Communication and Accessible Application Forms Across Sheffield City Council Services

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.
Please provide information on how Sheffield City Council meets its duties under the Equality Act 2010, including the duty to make reasonable adjustments for disabled individuals who are unable to use the telephone or standard online forms.
Specifically, I would like information relating to the following services:
Requests for aids and adaptations
Disabled Facilities Grant (DFG) applications
Care Needs Assessments (under the Care Act 2014)
Blue Badge applications
Disabled Bus Pass applications
Housing Benefit
Council Tax Support
Discretionary Housing Payments (DHP)
For each of the above, please confirm:
1. Whether individuals can request communication by email as a reasonable adjustment if they are unable to use the telephone or standard online forms.
2. Whether individuals can request to receive, complete, and return application forms in digitally editable formats, such as fillable PDF, Word document, or another accessible format.
3. The email address(es) to which completed forms and supporting evidence can be submitted, where a reasonable adjustment is agreed.
4. The process for requesting communication and form adjustments, and whether such adjustments are recorded and applied consistently across council departments.
5. Whether decision letters, requests for further information, or other correspondence can be provided in PDF format via email as part of an agreed reasonable adjustment.
6. Please provide copies of the fillable PDF (or other editable digital versions) of the relevant application forms for each service listed above, where these exist.
If any of this information is already publicly available, please provide direct links to the relevant guidance, policies, or documents.
Yours faithfully,
Emma Kirby

Dear Emma Kirby,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Reasonable
Adjustments for Communication and Accessible Application Forms which we
received on 30/04/2025.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 30/05/2025. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Please note that from 1^st January 2025, as part of our commitment to
improving services, the council will accept FOI requests via the online
